title: Sample Dataset on GCoM Adoption in Mexican Municipalities
description: A simplified open-access dataset including socioeconomic, demographic, and civic engagement variables related to the adoption of the Global Covenant of Mayors (GCoM) among Mexican municipalities.
source: INEGI (Instituto Nacional de Estadística y Geografía), 2010
CONEVAL (Consejo Nacional de Evaluación de la Política de Desarrollo Social), 2010

variables.State: Name of each state in Mexico.
variables.City/Mun: Name of the municipality in Mexico.
variables.CoM: 1 = municipality belongs to the Global Covenant of Mayors, 0 = municipality does not belong to the Global Covenant of Mayors
variables.pop_2010_LOG10: Base-10 logarithm of the total population in 2010
variables.Join_Year_GCoM: Year in which the municipality adopted the Global Covenant of Mayors
variables.AdultsBD2010: Adult population with a Bachelor's degree in 2010 (INEGI 2010)
variables.PercAdultsBD2010: Percentage of adult population with a Bachelor's degree in 2010
variables.PercPov2010: Percentage of the population living in poverty in 2010
variables.PubUniv: Number of public universities in the municipality
variables.PubUnivSt: Number of public universities in the state
variables.SocAssociations: 1 = municipality had a protest, 0 = municipality did not have a protest
variables.SocAssNum: Total number of social associations in the municipality

ethical_statement: Dataset includes only publicly available data and excludes sensitive or restricted information.
care_applicability: CARE principles do not apply (no Indigenous or culturally sensitive data).
